thread.title: Santa Fean Barrett Toan among big donors in presidential campaign
thread.title_full: Santa Fean Barrett Toan among big donors in presidential campaign | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Mark Oswald / Journal Staff Writer
title: Santa Fean Barrett Toan among big donors in presidential campaign
text:
Barrett Toan, a former health care executive who lives in Santa Fe, made a New York Times list of just 158 individuals, families or their companies whose contributions totaled $176 million in the first phase of the current presidential campaign, almost half of the money raised.
Barrett Toan
Toan, along with several others, is at the bottom rung of the big donors in the race for the White House through June 30. Toan gave $250,000 — the minimum to get on the Times list that was published Sunday— on June 15 to a super PAC supporting Democrat Hillary Clinton.
“Not since before Watergate have so few people and businesses provided so much early money in a campaign, most of it through channels legalized by the Supreme Court’s Citizens United decision five years ag,” the Times reported.
Toan gave $500,000 to the same super PAC, Priorities Action USA, for the 2012 campaign season, in which Priorities Action was supporting Barrack Obama.
Toan was president and CEO of St. Louis-based Express Scripts, a pharmacy-benefits management company, from 1989 until his retirement in 2005, and he serves on the board of bio-tech firm Sigma-Aldrich. He and his wife, Polly O’Brien, who worked in the administration of President Jimmy Carter, have lived in Santa Fe since 2008.
They are regular contributors to liberal causes and Democratic candidates in New Mexico and nationally. Last year, they gave $100,000 to Verde Voters PAC, created in 2012 by Conservation Voters New Mexico.
Toan’s big contribution in the presidential race this year was represented by the only dot in New Mexico on the Times’ nationwide map showing where the big donors are from.
